summary: Six npm package vulnerabilities detected in core-2.3.0.tgz dependencies, with the highest severity being 8.8 (CVE-2022-25967 in eta package enabling Remote Code Execution). Multiple transitive dependencies require updates to remediate security risks.
userImpact: Users are exposed to critical security vulnerabilities including Remote Code Execution through outdated transitive dependencies in the TypeScript SDK.
rootCause: Outdated transitive npm dependencies (eta 1.12.3, trim 0.0.1, http-cache-semantics 4.1.0, formula 3.0.0, got 9.6.0) with unpatched security vulnerabilities.
proposedFix: Upgrade vulnerable dependencies: eta to 2.0.0 or later, trim to 0.0.3 or later, http-cache-semantics to 4.1.1 or later, and update other affected transitive dependencies.
resolutionDetails: Vulnerabilities were addressed by upgrading dependencies. Comment indicates all dependencies have been updated.
keyQuote: All of these dependencies have updated a very long time ago.
